title: New: The Flaming Lips & Bon Iver – Ashes in the Air
body: [![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/IMG_7484-260x173.jpg "The Flaming Lips")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/9065-review-all-tomorrows-parties-deerhoof-dinosaur-jr-and-the-flaming-lips/attachment/img_7484/)_The Flaming Lips and Heavy Fwends_ is undoubtedly one of the more exciting releases coming to us on Record Store Day next month. Far from any bog standard vinyl re-release, it’s a full-sized compilation album featuring guest appearances from artists all the way from **Nick Cave** to **Ke$ha** – and here we have the first look at one of the brand new tracks off that album. With a guest appearance from **Bon Iver**, this track is very much **Justin Vernon** adapting to the style of **Coyne** and co, rather than vice versa. It’s a seriously awesome little song that not only demonstrates that **The Flaming Lips** are (once again) progressing on from their _Embryonic_ sound, but are also actually putting the effort in to releasing an genuinely well-made full album next month – which is something to get pretty damned excited about.
